27-28* At Dr* Goodell*s urging, I am looking into the pos¬
sibility of recruiting on* or more additional persons to
assist me on this project in the future, particularly after
Margery Morris*s departure* I have found several possibil¬
ities, but I have made no committments, pending notification
of the definite availability of funds and of your instruc¬
tions that on* or more additional persons be hired* Accord¬
ing to my understanding, Dr* Goodell expects to make funds
available for additional personnel*
5* Personnel. During the month of June, I worked on
the 65-script series and, with Margery Morris, on the 39-
script series* Dr* M* h* Rosendal continued to work on the
poetry series, but t had no contact with him, though Dr*
Goodell did show me three of his analyses* Allan Kulakow
provided conversations for the first 14 scripts in the 39-
script series, and I am now sending him copies of our revi¬
sions of these conversation and the problems which the
remaining scripts will deal with* As you know, under the
present plan, we are using one conversation for every two
lessons, or approximately 20 conversations in all* We have
had to revise Allan’s conversations substantially, but we
were generally able to use his situations and thereby save
a good deal of time* Miss Barbara Richardson, a graduate
student, has been doing our iyping, and I "will forward her
bill when she has finished typing the first 13 scripts.
She charges the standard rate in this area—35/^ per page
plus 5/- for each carbon* I have been having her make 3
carbons* I have contacted Dr* Stanley Saoon* but we have
not yet been able to make an arrangement for consultation*
I am now preparing a letter for him, and I will send you a
copy.
6* Expenses* Other than travel expenses, claims for
which have already been submitted, expenditures for this
project have been confined to communications thus far. I
enclose an itemized claim for these expenditures. They
total $4*13*
I am enclosing a copy of this letter for Dr. Goodell*
